name: Rental unit in Cambridge · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this pretty Alewife furnished one-bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and spacious living room. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Cambridge has to offer! (ID #BOS771)

The space
Thoughtfully designed with bespoke finishes, modern furnishings, and a fully-equipped kitchen, you’ll enjoy that “I’m home” feeling with this Blueground apartment. Whether you’re lounging in your beautiful living room streaming the latest and greatest entertainment on the smart TV or premium wireless speaker, or getting some well-earned rest on the superior quality mattress with luxury linens, you’ll fall in love with everything this Alewife apartment has to offer. This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.

Amenities

Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom include an on-site:

- BBQ Area
- Dryer
- Elevator
-
neighborhood_overview: This turnkey furnished apartment is located in Alewife, a fast-growing Cambridge neighborhood. There are plenty of cafes, restaurants and shops clustered around Alewife's T station. Anyone who likes to cook for themselves will be pleased by the selection at Ferro's Foodtown, a popular grocery store. Nature lovers can hike, bike, and birdwatch in the Alewife Brook Reservation. Alewife is served by several MBTA bus lines as well as the Red Line.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Bed and breakfast in Cambridge · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
description:
Relax in your own room or enjoy the comfy couch in the living room (brand new, will be delivered in early February), or hang out in the cozy eat-in-kitchen.

Strawberry Hill Cambridge is a calm yet connected spot! Get coffee at Intelligentsia (5 minute walk) or lunch at Sofra (5 minute walk).

There is always coffee and tea, toast, cereal, and all the basic materials and ingredients you need to cook in our kitchen. My son (14) lives here too, as well as our 2 sweet cats.

The space
Your room has a nice high quality Queen-size mattress, a desk, a chair, two lamps, a ceiling fan, and a dresser.

Guest access
You share the rest of the apartment with my son (14) and myself (42). There’s a living/dining room area, a big eat-in-kitchen, a bathroom, and laundry.

During your stay
Usually I’m at home and can help you with anything you might need; and of course we can also enjoy coffee or a nice meal togeth
neighborhood_overview:
Very nice Strawberry Hill in Cambridge, right on the border with Belmont and Watertown. Fresh Pond is around the corner for walks or runs. And two bus lines that go into Harvard Sq are within short walking distance.
Intelligentsia Café and SOFRA are our neighbors :)
host_about: Hi there :) I’m a German francophile academic, happily stranded here in Cambridge (for the time being). My son (14) and I (42) love to host people in our cozy West Cambridge apartment. We’ve got two lovely cats !

name: Rental unit in Cambridge · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
description:
**SUBLEASE AVAILABLE**

The space
Beautiful, spacious, 1 Bedroom/1 Bathroom apartment located in the heart of Porter Square. This apartment is part of a 3 bedroom apartment, shared with 2 graduate school students.
The entire basement of this apartment is yours. The basement includes a private bedroom, living room, bathroom, mini kitchen/bar, wine cooler, Nespresso machine, working desk, large closet, high-speed WiFi, and all utilities. A full kitchen is located on the 1st floor, and the washer/dryer is located on the 2nd floor. Kitchen utensils included.

The apartment is a 2min walking distance from Porter Square, which includes access to the Red Line, Smart Market, Target, and restaurants. The Red Line has a 15min transit to Downtown Boston from Porter Square. The location is also 1min walk from the Route 77 Bus Stop.

All utilities + Wifi INCLUDED.

Must be a 6-month sublease from March 1st to September 1st.

name: Home in Cambridge · 2 bedrooms · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
description:
Must love dogs. Bruno is the big pup in the profile pic. He is a mixed rottweiler/pitbull but looks like a Lab. Guests must be willing to live with him and even help care for him when I travel. Bodie is my brother and his wife’s dog. They live in separate apartments upstairs. The two dogs love to play outside and in when we let them. If you are a dog person and I haven't deterred you, let me tell you more about the apartment. There is much to love about the house, living space, and neighborhood.

The space
They call this house type “Philadelphia style.” The first floor is pretty open with a living room/dining room/kitchen - and the bathroom and my bedroom. The room for rent is up a set of stairs to the single room on the second floor.
It is an old house with some natural charm. The kitchen and bathroom were renovated about six years ago. There are hardwood floors throughout - and great natural light. It is brightly decorated with lots of original eclectic
neighborhood_overview:
There are a few restaurants literally across the street, a bank, high end grocery store Formaggio, and other cute shops.
About one-half mile west of Harvard Square and Fresh Pond is the Observatory Hill neighborhood. Its neighborhood retail and business center is found around the intersection of Concord and Huron Avenues. Further out Huron Avenue towards Fresh Pond is the set of businesses known as Huron Village. Both of these centers offer a variety of neighborhood restaurants, grocery stores, some small offices, and unique retail and specialty shops that serve the surrounding community.
host_about:
I am Democratic political consultant who travels a lot for business and pleasure both domestically and internationally. My homes are showcases for the various art and handicrafts I have picked up along the way.

I have homes in Kigali, Rwanda, Washington, DC and in Cambridge, MA that  I list on AIRBNB and try to use AIRBNB when I travel as well. 

My brother Adam manages the Cambridge house most of the time and will be your primary contact should you choose to stay there. My friend Whinock helps me manage guest communications in Kigali  and we have a full staff to support guests there.

host_about:
Welcome to your home away from home! 
My name is Adam am a part of the Compass Furnished Apartments and ARTlab Living reservations team. 

We have 450+ furnished apartments throughout the Northeast, allowing us to provide you with homes, wherever, whenever and for whatever your need, with extreme flexibility. Our portfolio offers options for all budgets, lifestyles, and needs to best support you. 

We run like a well-oiled machine, and have created a company that prides itself on consistency and quality. Our apartments are move in ready, and come with high speed internet, high quality furnishings, and full kitchens with housewares to support quick trips or long term business stays, all you need to bring is your suitcase! 

It is our mission to make you feel like a local, providing you with a curated experience all at an tremendous value. It's what we like to call - Hospitality Redefined.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950’s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.
host_about:
We’re Blueground, a global proptech company with several thousand move-in-ready apartments in a growing number of major cities around the world. With flexible terms and homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel at home and free to roam for as long as you want — a month, a year, or longer. 

Each apartment is thoughtfully designed with exclusive furnishings, fully equipped kitchens, and incredible amenities – making every day a five-star experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed Wi-Fi, premium linens, and smart home entertainment. Plus, access to pools, gyms, and outdoor spaces in select buildings.

Why stress over your apartment? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily. 

Even better? You can enhance your stay with car rentals, grocery delivery, laundry services, and more through our special partnerships. 

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via email, phone, and our Guest App, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels. 

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

neighborhood_overview:
This is a family-friendly neighborhood, with a playground right around the corner. Most residents in the area are either families, or teachers/students from Harvard. You will find the Fresh Pond Golf Course right across the Street, and there are plenty of family-owned restaurants, cafes and shops nearby. You'll be close to the Harvard University campus, this makes the area extra friendly and open to all kinds of people, since we have visitors from everywhere almost all the time.

If you’re a student or teacher, our property is the best option for you! We welcome tourists, business professionals and medical workers as well!

name: Rental unit in Cambridge · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
description:
Our 3-bedroom, 1 bathroom home is located in the heart of West Cambridge - close to Huron Village, public transportation, Harvard and Porter Square, as well as a short walk to the Charles River. Walkable to restaurants, local library, coffee shops, clothing stores, many playgrounds and more!! There are hardwood floors throughout the home, generous sized rooms, and a shared backyard for family BBQs or small gatherings.. You would also have access to a parking spot in our driveway.

The space
It is a Philadelphia-style home with 2 bedrooms and a full bath on the main level and an additional bedroom upstairs. One bedroom on the first floor has a queen bed and the other twin bunk beds. Upstairs is a full bed.

Guest access
You’ll have access to the whole apartment. The front and backyard are shared, but most often available to use!
neighborhood_overview: Located in a wonderfully central area. Easy access to route 2 to head out west, very close to multiple red line stops that can take you into Boston, and walking distance to many stores, restaurants, and community resources (playgrounds, library, public pools, etc). Located right in Huron village, the home is walking distance to delicious Peruvian, Chinese, Nepalese, Italian, and other restaurants, as well as cafes, a rare book store, children’s stores and a number of boutiques, salons, yoga studios, and so much more! It is also walking distance to Fresh Pond Reservoir which provides a beautiful 2+ mile walking/running loop that feels removed from the city life. Trader Joe’s, While Foods, CVS, Apple Cinemas and more are a five minute drive down the road. It’s a wonderful neighborhood where people are friendly and there is lots to do!

A corner lot in a quiet neighborhood, with a grassy yard on three sides and small city garden across the street. A block from Danehy Park, a five minute walk to Huron Village and Fresh Pond Reservation, a twenty minute walk to Porter Square, and a quick bus ride to Harvard Square. A perfect home base for college tours and working vacations. The owners, long time Airbnb travelers, live upstairs.

Spacious but cozy two bedroom apartment with a large living/dining area, eat in kitchen and laundry in the unit. One bedroom has a queen sized bed and the other has been configured as a study, with a queen pull out sofa (we think it's very comfortable!) and desk for working. Because it's a two-family home, you might occasionally hear walking overhead.

Guest access
The shared back yard has a grill, table and chairs for eating, and comfortable

name: Rental unit in Cambridge · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
description:
Comfort and Location! This charming 3 bedroom Cambridge apartment is on the second and third floors of our 2-family home on quiet, pretty Hollis Street, steps from Davis Square (Somerville) and Porter Square (Cambridge), including Harvard Sq. which is 1.5 miles away. You won't need a car - we are next to public transportation to Boston, its colleges and medical centers, and all surrounding communities.

Other things to note
SAVE! F YOU BOOK MORE THAN 31 NIGHTS, THERE ARE NO LOCAL OR STATE TAXES - PLUS YOU GET A SUBSTANTIAL DISCOUNT.
neighborhood_overview:
This is a safe neighborhood with a lot of open space. Besides our yard, which is considered large by city standards, there is a school with public playing fields, two playgrounds, and public tennis courts at the end of the street on Rindge Avenue. Right around the corner, on Sherman Street, there is a giant public park - Danehy Park - with playgrounds and playing fields, trails for walking and jogging, and in the winter, a giant hill for sledding.

The location gets even more perfect....You can get easily anywhere and everywhere from Hollis Street without a car. Walk, bike, or take public transportation. You will be close to the major universities, museums, medical centers, and other attractions of the Boston- Cambridge area. Hip Davis Square (Somerville) is just short five -minute walk, with its historic movie theater and great restaurants. There are many other restaurants right around the corner on Massachusetts Avenue, like Urban Kitchen (American), Café Barada (Middle-Eas
host_about:
I'm a college professor, with a husband and 3 grown kids and Cambridge is our home. We have a two family house in North Cambridge that was built in 1926. My husband, Gerry, and I live in the upstairs apartment and our first floor apartment is available for short and long-term guests. 

When part of my mother's family emigrated to Cambridge at the turn of last century from Co. Kerry, Ireland, they settled in our Hollis Street neighborhood that was once called "Little Dublin". Her cousins became successful funeral home owners and leaders in the Cambridge community. This neighborhood was also home to the famous House Speaker, "Tip" O'Neil, and has a rich history, dating back to the Revolutionary War. The first floor apartment is where my parents once lived and it has been renovated and is now available for you to enjoy.

name: Home in Cambridge · 4 bedrooms · 3 beds · 3 baths
description:
Family-friendly, spacious and central, with comfortable spaces inside and out. *Discounts available for 1-week or longer stays.*

The space
The first floor is open-concept with 2 living rooms in the front and back, and the kitchen and dining room in between. The back living room has an adjoining full bath (shower) and opens onto the back patio. The second floor has all 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, and an office. The third floor is a bonus space and includes a futon. There is laundry in the basement.

Other things to note
There's a rowing machine in the basement, bikes and scooters for small kids in the outdoor shed, and a full size picnic table in the backyard. Off-street parking on the side of the house can be made available -- just let us know if this is something you'll need. *Discounts available for 1-week or longer stays.*

name: Rental unit in Cambridge · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
description:
Show up and start living from day one in Cambridge with this lovely one-bedroom Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully-equipped Cambridgeport home. (ID #BOS851)

This spacious, light-filled townhouse is an oasis of calm that’s close to everything. Come back from a visit to Harvard or MIT, a walk along the river, the Marathon, or a Sox game and enter a home full of pleasant surprises from museum-quality art to jewelbox bathrooms to a shaded back patio.

The space
The great room takes up most of the first floor and consists of a kitchen, dining area, library, fireplace, and sitting area. It's a space designed to bring people into contact and conversation with each other throughout the day.

neighborhood_overview:
Cambridgeport is an old residential neighborhood that's close to everything. It's an easy walk from the house to Harvard Yard (23 minutes), MIT's Great Dome (17), the Charles River (12), Fenway Park (35) and the Central Square T stop (8).

The area has everything: iconic live-music venues; speakeasy-ish bars, food from all over the world — even a dispensary ;). There's a kid-friendly park a block away, two of the world's top universities nearby, and serendipity in every direction.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950’s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

neighborhood_overview:
East Cambridge is a vibrant and diverse neighborhood located just across the Charles River from Boston, Massachusetts. It is known for its mix of residential and commercial areas, as well as its historic architecture and cultural landmarks. Here are some key features of the neighborhood:

1. Residential areas: East Cambridge is home to a mix of residential areas, including historic homes, apartments, and newer developments. Many residents are young professionals who work in the nearby tech and biotech industries.

2. Kendall Square: Kendall Square is a major commercial and cultural center in East Cambridge. It is home to several tech and biotech companies, as well as restaurants, cafes, and cultural institutions like the MIT Museum.

3. Green spaces: East Cambridge has several parks and green spaces, including the popular Charles River Reservation. The CambridgeSide Galleria Mall also has a rooftop garden and park that offers great views of the city.

host_about: Hello! I'm Liesl - and yes, my mother was a fan of "The Sound of Music"! Originally from New Jersey, I came to Boston for college and after a couple years living in Europe, I returned to make my home here. I've lived in Fenway, Beacon Hill, the South End and now in Jamaica Plain with my husband and two teenage sons. Many years working in the travel industry gave me a great background for my shift to  hospitality. I love working with travelers and we've had guests from all over the world - so interesting to hear your stories and what brings you to Boston. I would love to host you and give you all the inside info about what makes Boston a great place to visit!

neighborhood_overview:
Somerville is considered to be a highly walkable and bike-able city. Somerville hosts 21 Bluebikes (originally Hubway) stations, one of which is located right in Porter Square (Elm St).

Porter Square is a neighborhood in Cambridge and Somerville, between Harvard and Davis Squares. The Porter Square station has both the MBTA Red Line and the Commuter Rail Fitchburg Line. A major part of the Lesley University campus is located within the Porter Square area. There are also many shops and restaurants. Within the Art Deco-style building located at 1815 Massachusetts Avenue, The "Shops at Porter" have a recent history of being a center for Boston's Japanese community and is home to many Japanese eateries. Nearby, on Mass Ave on the other side of porter square is Yume Wo Katare, a ramen noodle restaurant that shouldn't be missed!

neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to the lively and historic neighborhood nestled between the picturesque Charles River and the prestigious Harvard University in Cambridge, MA! This charming and sophisticated community is characterized by a unique blend of intellectual energy, cultural diversity, and a rich historical ambiance.

As you meander through the tree-lined streets of this captivating neighborhood, you'll be mesmerized by the stunning architecture reflecting the deep-rooted history of Cambridge. The area is dotted with beautifully maintained Victorian and Queen Anne-style homes, which add a touch of elegance to this esteemed locale.

Located just a stone's throw away from Harvard Square, you'll enjoy unparalleled access to world-class dining, boutique shopping, and an eclectic mix of art galleries, theaters, and museums. The neighborhood also boasts numerous lush parks and green spaces, ideal for a leisurely afternoon picnic or an invigorating morning jog.

neighborhood_overview:
This neighborhood houses one of the best-known high-tech and innovation hubs of the United States and arguably has the highest concentration of PhD's in the world.

However, this neighborhood is probably the most "below the radar" for tourists, but what it lacks in glamour it more than makes up for it in total, earnest hidden-gem-ness. Cruise down its main aorta, Cambridge Street, for access to some of the best fish markets, Portuguese bakeries, and well-loved bars in town. Mall rats can get their fill between the Cambridgeside Galleria and the Twin City Plaza shopping center, but one would be remiss to pass up stylish treasures at the Cambridge Antique Market. The residential makeup is richly diverse,anchored with strong Irish and Portuguese communities. Local pride runs thick.

name: Townhouse in Cambridge · ★New · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2.5 baths
description:
History with modern comforts. Beautiful, red brick townhouse in the heart of Cambridge. 45 second walk from the Central Square T-Stop. Built in 1855 by a master mason, it is recognized as a historic property. Classic Cantabrigian roots but meticulously renovated in 2023 to be a modern luxury 4 BR house with a private gym, spa, and garage. Brand new fixtures, equipment, infrastructure (central AC, in-floor heating), and the latest tech for spa, fitness, entertainment, cooking, and sustainability.

The space
Easy-to-Use Modern Comforts
As you approach the house, you immediately notice the dramatic, unmistakable ivy coverage on the red brick wall. Walking past the black iron fence and the roses in the newly redesigned and renovated front yard, you get to the carefully restored original doors of the Cambridge Ivy House, as it's come to be known over the years. Once in, you’ll see that everything from top to bottom has been recently (2023) and thoroughly overhaule

Stroll to Charles river, get on the river bicycle loop route, take a train to downtown Boston (about a 5 minutes walk) or walk to Havard/MIT.

name: Rental unit in Cambridge · ★New · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 3 baths
description:
Welcome to our rare, 3-bedroom 3-bathroom multi-level single-family home located in the much sought-after Riverside neighborhood of Cambridge, MA. Nestled between vibrant Harvard and Central Squares, MIT, Harvard University, and the Charles River, this location offers the perfect blend of convenience and accessibility.

The space
Tucked away from the street, this renovated home boasts hardwood floors throughout and central air conditioning. The oversized living room welcomes you with a comfortable leather sectional and a 55" flat-screen TV. Adjacent to the living area, you'll find a formal dining space, a large kitchen with ample cabinets, an additional wet bar, a full bathroom, and an office area.

As you head up to the 2nd floor, you'll discover the large master bedroom featuring a walk-in closet, a skylighted bathroom with double sinks, a jacuzzi tub, and a private balcony with seating. The two other bedrooms are thoughtfully furnished with queen beds
neighborhood_overview: Described as a walker's paradise with excellent transit. You'll find yourself just 0.4 miles away from the Red Line Central Square station, as well as Whole Foods, Trader Joe's. The neighborhood is brimming with shops, restaurants, and cafes, ensuring you'll always have something exciting to explore. Easily accessible to the bustling Longwood Medical area hospitals, Harvard University and MIT.
host_about:
Welcome to STARS of Boston (Short Term Apartment Rental Solutions) -- our name says it all! We offer stylishly furnished and accessorized apartments as superior value alternatives to hotels. Our private rooms, studio, one, two, three & four bedroom apartments and homes have been carefully curated to provide a refuge for work, play or rejuvenation. 
STARS offers flexible term stays in the most desirable areas around Greater Boston, Brookline, Longwood Medical Area, most major universities and Cambridge. Our units are pet friendly and accessible by public transit or order up VIP service for airport transfers, a personal driver or pet and child care. Special request? We’ll gladly check into it. We’d love to host you, just call or email us for best rates and availability. I was born and raised in Greater Boston and work in real estate in Brookline for 17 years and counting.
